original: de nyid las dung 'dra bar byas pa ni dri'i phyag rgya'o zhes pa ni 'di ltar mthe bo dang mthe'u chung gnyis bsnyams la lhag ma rnams rtse sbrad tsam du bzung nas spos khang gi tshul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las dung 'dra bar byas pa ni dri'i phyag rgya'o zhes pa ni 'di ltar mthe bo dang mthe'u chung gnyis bsnyams la lhag ma rnams rtse sbrad tsam du bzung nas spos khang gi tshul du byas pa'o //
translated: Thus, the two thumbs and little fingers are joined, and the remaining fingers are held just touching at the tips, made in the manner of an incense case.

original: de nyid las sor mo rnams brkyang ba 'og nas gyen du me tog 'thor ba'i tshul du @96b byas pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid las sor mo rnams brkyang ba 'og nas gyen du me tog 'thor ba'i tshul du @96b byas pa ste /
translated: From that very mudra, the fingers are extended, made in the manner of throwing flowers upward from below.

original: de ni me tog gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ni me tog gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the pledge seal of flowers.

original: rdo rje khu tshur bsdams pa las mthe bong gnyis bsgreng ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur bsdams pa las mthe bong gnyis bsgreng ba ste /
translated: From the vajra fist, the two thumbs are extended.

original: mdun na 'dzin pa ni mar me'i'o //
analyzed: mdun na 'dzin pa ni mar me'i'o //
translated: Holding in front, it is the lamp.

original: dung 'dra bar shes pa ni lag pa gnyis srin lag dang mthe'u chung bzhi bsnol la bskams te gung mo gnyis lto sbyar la brkyang nas mthe bong gnyis kyis brkyang ba'i rtse mo la mdzub mo gnyis bkug pa'i rtse mo sprad de /
analyzed: dung 'dra bar shes pa ni lag pa gnyis srin lag dang mthe'u chung bzhi bsnol la bskams te gung mo gnyis lto sbyar la brkyang nas mthe bong gnyis kyis brkyang ba'i rtse mo la mdzub mo gnyis bkug pa'i rtse mo sprad de /
translated: The gesture of the conch is made by crossing the four fingers, the ring fingers and the little fingers, of both hands, and then extending the two middle fingers with the palms together. The tips of the two thumbs are extended and the tips of the two index fingers are bent and touch.

original: de dag ni yongs su 'brel pa'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: de dag ni yongs su 'brel pa'i dam tshig go //
translated: These are the pledges of complete union.

original: de nyid las rab tu brkyang ste 'dzin pa ni gtor ma'i phyag rgya'o /
analyzed: de nyid las rab tu brkyang ste 'dzin pa ni gtor ma'i phyag rgya'o /
translated: From that very [gesture], extend and hold [the fingers]‚Äîthis is the bali offering gesture.

original: de nyid las gung mo gnyis nang du bkug pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid las gung mo gnyis nang du bkug pa ni //
translated: From that very [gesture], bend the two middle fingers [into the palm]‚ÄîüîΩthis is the argha gesture.

original: aargha'i phyag rgya'o zhes pa ni sor mo rnams so sor sbyar nas bar phye ste brkyang pa ni gtor ma gtong ba'i skabs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: aargha'i phyag rgya'o zhes pa ni sor mo rnams so sor sbyar nas bar phye ste brkyang pa ni gtor ma gtong ba'i skabs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The fingers are joined individually, separated, and extended. This should be known in the context of offering the bali.

original: de nas mdzub mo dang srin lag dang mthe'u chung rnams ngos sbyar la rtse sprad de /
analyzed: de nas mdzub mo dang srin lag dang mthe'u chung rnams ngos sbyar la rtse sprad de /
translated: Then, join the tips of the index, ring, and little fingers,

original: mthe bong gnyis mdzub mo'i tshigs bar ma la brten nas gung mo gnyis mthe bong gi ngal mo gnyis la bkug ste sbyar ba ste de ni aargha dbul ba'i skabs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis mdzub mo'i tshigs bar ma la brten nas gung mo gnyis mthe bong gi ngal mo gnyis la bkug ste sbyar ba ste de ni aargha dbul ba'i skabs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The two thumbs are placed between the joints of the index fingers, and the two index fingers are bent and joined to the joints of the thumbs. This should be known as the occasion for offering argha.

original: rdo rje bcings pa las gung mo gnyis bsnyams te /
analyzed: rdo rje bcings pa las gung mo gnyis bsnyams te /
translated: From the vajra bond, the two middle fingers are joined together,

original: tshigs bcag pa la sor mo gzhan brkyang ba ni rnam par 'thor ba'i phyag rgya'o ;
analyzed: tshigs bcag pa la sor mo gzhan brkyang ba ni rnam par 'thor ba'i phyag rgya'o ;
translated: and the other fingers are extended with the joints bent. This is the mudra of Vikira.

original: / de nyid las mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis bkug pa ni rnam par 'joms pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: / de nyid las mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis bkug pa ni rnam par 'joms pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From that very mudra, the two thumbs and the two pinky fingers are bent. This is the mudra of Vidyaraja.

original: de nyid las 'od zer 'bar ba ni gzi brjid phung po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las 'od zer 'bar ba ni gzi brjid phung po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From that very mudra, blazing light rays are the mudra of Tejoraja.

original: de nyid las spyi bor bskor ba ni gdugs dkar po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las spyi bor bskor ba ni gdugs dkar po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From that very mudra, circling above the head is the mudra of Sitapattra.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las mdzub mo gnyis dang mthe'u chung gnyis bsnol te mdud pa gyen du bskor ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las mdzub mo gnyis dang mthe'u chung gnyis bsnol te mdud pa gyen du bskor ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From the two vajra fists, the two index fingers and two pinky fingers are crossed, and the knot is turned upward. This is the mudra of Cakravartin.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis rdo rjer byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis rdo rjer byas la /
translated: From the vajra-binding, the two middle fingers are made into a vajra,

original: mdzub mo gnyis rin po che ltar byas te lhag ma rnams 'od zer 'dra bar byas pa ni rgyal ba gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis rin po che ltar byas te lhag ma rnams 'od zer 'dra bar byas pa ni rgyal ba gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: the two index fingers are made into a jewel, and the remaining fingers are made like light rays. This is the mudra of Jina-ushihshajra.

original: de bzhin du mdzub mo gnyis rdo rje byas la sor mo lhag ma rnams bsdams pas rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa ni rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o //üîΩg-yas pa mchog sbyin du byas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzub mo gnyis rdo rje byas la sor mo lhag ma rnams bsdams pas rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa ni rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o // g-yas pa mchog sbyin du byas la /
translated: Likewise, the two index fingers are made into a vajra, and the remaining fingers are bound and made like a vajra. This is the mudra of Vijaya.üîΩThe right hand is made into a boon-granting gesture,

original: g-yon pa mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni @97a * //
analyzed: g-yon pa mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni @97a * //
translated: and the left hand is made into a fear-not gesture.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya yin no zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya yin no zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: This is the mudra of Tathagata.

original: de la dang po rdo rje bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis rtse sbrad la tshigs bar ma bcag ste /
analyzed: de la dang po rdo rje bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis rtse sbrad la tshigs bar ma bcag ste /
translated: In that regard, first, from the vajra-binding, the two middle fingers are crossed at the tips, and the middle joints are not bent.

original: lag pa gnyis kyi mthil sbyar la lhag ma rnams so sor brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyi mthil sbyar la lhag ma rnams so sor brkyang ba'o //
translated: The two palms are joined, and the remaining fingers are extended individually.

original: gnyis pa ne mthe bong gis mthe'u chung mnan te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ne mthe bong gis mthe'u chung mnan te /
translated: Second, the little finger is pressed with the thumb,üîΩand the remaining fingers are extended like a sword.

original: nang du bcug la gung mo snga ma bas rgya che bar byas la mdzub mo dang srin lag gnyis de la brten te lto sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: nang du bcug la gung mo snga ma bas rgya che bar byas la mdzub mo dang srin lag gnyis de la brten te lto sbyar ba'o //
translated: Inserting the hands inside, the thumbs are spread wider than before, and the index and ring fingers are joined together in a pouch.

original: gsum pa ni mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis so sor bsnol la nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis so sor bsnol la nang du bcug ste /
translated: The third is to cross the thumbs and little fingers individually, insert them inside,

original: sor mo drug phan tshun bsnol ba brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: sor mo drug phan tshun bsnol ba brkyang ba'o //
translated: and extend the six fingers crossed with each other.

original: bzhi pa ni mthe bong dang mthe'u chung so sor rtse sprad la brkyang ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mthe bong dang mthe'u chung so sor rtse sprad la brkyang ste /
translated: The fourth is to extend the thumbs and little fingers, touching tip to tip,

original: sor mo drug phan tshun du bsnol bas brkyang la lag pa kha sbub ste spyi bo'i steng du bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sor mo drug phan tshun du bsnol bas brkyang la lag pa kha sbub ste spyi bo'i steng du bskor bar bya'o //
translated: and extend the six fingers crossed with each other, turning the palms down and circling above the head.

original: lnga pa ni lag pa gnyis rgyab sprad la mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung so sor mdung te /
analyzed: lnga pa ni lag pa gnyis rgyab sprad la mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung so sor mdung te /
translated: The fifth is to join the backs of the two hands, the index and little fingers touching tip to tip,

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du rtse mo bsnol la mthe bong gnyis lag pa g-yas pa'i mthil du rtse sprad pas gyen du bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du rtse mo bsnol la mthe bong gnyis lag pa g-yas pa'i mthil du rtse sprad pas gyen du bskor bar bya'o //
translated: and the remaining ones likewise crossed at the tips. The two thumbs touch tip to tip in the center of the right palm and are circled upward.

original: drug pa ni gung mo gnyis lto sbyar la bsgreng ste rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i tshul du byas nas mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad la tshigs par ma bcag la rin po che'i tshul du byas te /
analyzed: drug pa ni gung mo gnyis lto sbyar la bsgreng ste rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i tshul du byas nas mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad la tshigs par ma bcag la rin po che'i tshul du byas te /
translated: The sixth is to join the palms together, erect, in the form of a single-pointed vajra, and then to touch the tips of the two index fingers together, not bending the joints, and to make them into the form of a jewel.

original: lhag ma rnams bsnol te brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams bsnol te brkyang ba'o //
translated: The remaining fingers are crossed and extended.

original: bdun pa ni sor mo rnams bsnol te bsdams nas gung mo gnyis lto sbyar nas bsgreng ba ste /
analyzed: bdun pa ni sor mo rnams bsnol te bsdams nas gung mo gnyis lto sbyar nas bsgreng ba ste /
translated: The seventh is to cross the fingers and hold them together, erect, with the two middle fingers joined together.

original: brgyad pa ni go slabs ma bshad do //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni go slabs ma bshad do //
translated: The eighth is easy to understand and is not explained.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa las mdzub mo gnyis brkyang ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa las mdzub mo gnyis brkyang ste /
translated: From the vajra bond, extend the two index fingers

original: rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa ni rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa ni rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: and make them into the form of a vajra. This is the vajra seal.

original: de nyid las mdzub mo g-yas pa bkug pa ni lcags kyu'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las mdzub mo g-yas pa bkug pa ni lcags kyu'i'o //
translated: From that very [mudra], bend the right index finger. This is the hook seal.

original: de nyid las me tog 'dra bar byas pa ni mda'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las me tog 'dra bar byas pa ni mda'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From that very [mudra], make it into the form of a flower. This is the arrow seal.

original: de nyid las slar bkug ste mthe bong gi rtse mo gnyis rtse sprad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid las slar bkug ste mthe bong gi rtse mo gnyis rtse sprad pa ni /
translated: From that very [mudra], bend it back and touch the tips of the two thumbs together.

original: blo gros legs pa'i'o //
analyzed: blo gros legs pa'i'o //
translated: This is the seal of excellent wisdom.

original: de nyid las tshigs bar ma bcag pa ni rin po che'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las tshigs bar ma bcag pa ni rin po che'i'o //
translated: From that very mudra, if the fingers are not separated, it is the precious mudra.

original: de nyid las sor mo rnams 'od zer 'dra bar byas pa de gzi brjid kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las sor mo rnams 'od zer 'dra bar byas pa de gzi brjid kyi'o //
translated: From that very mudra, if the fingers are made like rays of light, it is the splendor mudra.

original: de nyid las spyi bor gzhag pa ni me tog gi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las spyi bor gzhag pa ni me tog gi'o //
translated: From that very mudra, if it is placed on the crown, it is the flower mudra.

original: de nyid las mdun du @97b gzhag pa ni bzhad pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las mdun du @97b gzhag pa ni bzhad pa'i'o //
translated: From that very mudra, if it is placed in front, it is the smiling mudra.

original: de nyid las padma 'dra bar byas pa ni padma'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las padma 'dra bar byas pa ni padma'i'o //
translated: From that very mudra, if it is made like a lotus, it is the lotus mudra.

original: de nyid las rtse mo yid tsam bkug pa ni ral gri'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rtse mo yid tsam bkug pa ni ral gri'i'o //
translated: From that very mudra, if the tips are slightly bent, it is the sword mudra.

original: de nyid las gdugs 'dra bar byas pa ni 'khor lo'i'o //üîΩde nyid las padma'i 'dab ma 'dra bar byas pa ni lce'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las gdugs 'dra bar byas pa ni 'khor lo'i'o // de nyid las padma'i 'dab ma 'dra bar byas pa ni lce'i'o //
translated: From that very mudra, if it is made like a parasol, it is the wheel mudra.üîΩFrom that very mudra, if it is made like a lotus petal, it is the tongue mudra.

original: de nyid las rtse mo yid tsam bskyed pa ni rgya gram gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rtse mo yid tsam bskyed pa ni rgya gram gyi'o //
translated: From that very mudra, if the tips are slightly extended, it is the crossed-vajra mudra.

original: de nyid las shin tu bskyed pa ni bsrung ba'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las shin tu bskyed pa ni bsrung ba'i'o //
translated: From that very mudra, if the tips are fully extended, it is the protection mudra.

original: de nyid las rtse mo gnyis slar bkug pa ni gnod sbyin gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rtse mo gnyis slar bkug pa ni gnod sbyin gyi'o //
translated: From that very mudra, if the two tips are bent back, it is the yak·π£a mudra.üîΩFrom that very mudra, if it is tightly bent, it is the binding mudra.

original: de nyid las dam du bkug pa ni bsdams pa'i'o zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nyid las dam du bkug pa ni bsdams pa'i'o zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: de la dang po ni sor mo rnams bsnol te dam par bsdams pa las mdzub mo gnyis lto sbyar te bsgreng ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni sor mo rnams bsnol te dam par bsdams pa las mdzub mo gnyis lto sbyar te bsgreng ba'o //
translated: The first is to cross the fingers and hold them tightly together, then extend the two index fingers with the backs together.

original: gnyis pa ni thams cad bsdams pa las mdzub mo g-yas pa phyung ste bkug pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni thams cad bsdams pa las mdzub mo g-yas pa phyung ste bkug pa'o //
translated: The second is to hold all the fingers together, then extend the right index finger and bend it.

original: gsum pa ni gong ma'i tshul las mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad de tshigs gnyis ying tsam rgu ba'o ;
analyzed: gsum pa ni gong ma'i tshul las mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad de tshigs gnyis ying tsam rgu ba'o ;
translated: The third is to extend the two index fingers together, with the two joints bent slightly, in the manner of the previous one.

original: / bzhi pa ni mthe bong gnyis gshibs te brkyang la mdzub mo gnyis kyi sen mo dang tshigs dang po sprad la mthe bong gi rtse mo nas mnan nas gru bzhi pa'i tshul du byas ba'o //
analyzed: / bzhi pa ni mthe bong gnyis gshibs te brkyang la mdzub mo gnyis kyi sen mo dang tshigs dang po sprad la mthe bong gi rtse mo nas mnan nas gru bzhi pa'i tshul du byas ba'o //
translated: The fourth is to extend the two thumbs side by side, touch the fingernails of the two index fingers to the first joint, and press down on the tips of the thumbs, making a square shape.

original: lnga pa ni rdo rje bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis kyi tshigs bar ma bcag pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni rdo rje bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis kyi tshigs bar ma bcag pa'o //
translated: The fifth is to extend the two middle fingers, with the joints of the two index fingers touching, in the manner of the vajra binding.

original: drug pa ni sor mo rnams phan tshun du bsnol nas brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni sor mo rnams phan tshun du bsnol nas brkyang ba'o //
translated: The sixth is to extend the fingers crossed with each other.

original: bdun pa ni sor mo rnams bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis ka rtse sprad de tshigs gnyis yid tsam rgur bar byas nas spyi bor gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ni sor mo rnams bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis ka rtse sprad de tshigs gnyis yid tsam rgur bar byas nas spyi bor gzhag pa'o //
translated: The seventh is to place the hands on the crown of the head with the middle fingers touching and the two joints slightly bent.

original: brgyad pa ni gung mo gnyis bsgreng nas bkyed de kha'i thad kar gzhag go //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni gung mo gnyis bsgreng nas bkyed de kha'i thad kar gzhag go //
translated: The eighth is to extend the middle fingers and place them in front of the mouth.

original: dgu pa ni srin lag gnyis rtse sprad la tshigs dang po dang bar ma gnyis rgur bar byas te brtan por gzung ba'o //
analyzed: dgu pa ni srin lag gnyis rtse sprad la tshigs dang po dang bar ma gnyis rgur bar byas te brtan por gzung ba'o //
translated: The ninth is to touch the tips of the two ring fingers together and hold them firmly with the first and middle joints slightly bent.

original: bcu pa ni srin lag rtse sprad la tshigs dang po bcag pa lto sbyar ba'o //üîΩbcu gcig pa ni mthe bong gnyis rtse sprad nas steng du brkyang la g-yon pa bkug pa de mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad nas zlum por byas pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa ni srin lag rtse sprad la tshigs dang po bcag pa lto sbyar ba'o // bcu gcig pa ni mthe bong gnyis rtse sprad nas steng du brkyang la g-yon pa bkug pa de mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad nas zlum por byas pa'o //
translated: The tenth is to touch the tips of the two ring fingers together and join the first joints as if broken.üîΩThe eleventh is to extend the two thumbs upward and bend the left one, and the two index fingers touch at the tips and form a circle.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni srin lag gi rtse mo gnyis rtse sprad nas tshigs gnyis yid tsam rgu bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni srin lag gi rtse mo gnyis rtse sprad nas tshigs gnyis yid tsam rgu bar byas pa'o //
translated: The twelfth is to touch the tips of the two ring fingers together and bend the two joints slightly.

original: bcu gsum pa ni gung mo gnyis lto sbyar te bsgreng la mdzub mo gnyis sna tshogs rdo rje'i @98a * //üîΩtshul du sna bkyed la gzung bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa ni gung mo gnyis lto sbyar te bsgreng la mdzub mo gnyis sna tshogs rdo rje'i @98a * // tshul du sna bkyed la gzung bar byas pa'o //
translated: The thirteenth is to join the two middle fingers together and raise them up, and to open the two index fingers like a crossed vajra.

original: bcu bzhi pa ni gung mo gnyis rtse sprad pa bsgreng ste mtho bo gnyis rtse sprad la bsgreng nas shin tu bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa ni gung mo gnyis rtse sprad pa bsgreng ste mtho bo gnyis rtse sprad la bsgreng nas shin tu bskyed pa'o //
translated: The fourteenth is to join the tips of the two middle fingers together and raise them up, and to join the tips of the two index fingers together and raise them up, fully extended.

original: bco lnga pa ni mdzub mo gnyis rtse mo rgu bar byas la mthe bong gshibs pa'o//
analyzed: bco lnga pa ni mdzub mo gnyis rtse mo rgu bar byas la mthe bong gshibs pa'o//
translated: The fifteenth is to bend the tips of the two index fingers and join the two thumbs together.

original: bcu drug pa ni mthe bong dang mthe chung gnyis nang du bcug la lhag ma rnams phan tshun du bsnol te dam du bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: bcu drug pa ni mthe bong dang mthe chung gnyis nang du bcug la lhag ma rnams phan tshun du bsnol te dam du bsdams pa'o //
translated: The sixteenth is to insert the thumb and little finger inside and cross the remaining fingers together, binding them tightly.

original: khu tshur las mthe bong bsgreng ba ni sgeg mo'i'o //üîΩde nyid las bskyed pa ni phreng ba ma'i'o //üîΩde nyid las sor mo rnams brkyang ba ni glu mkhan ma'i'o //
analyzed: khu tshur las mthe bong bsgreng ba ni sgeg mo'i'o // de nyid las bskyed pa ni phreng ba ma'i'o // de nyid las sor mo rnams brkyang ba ni glu mkhan ma'i'o //
translated: The gesture of the flirtatious one is to raise the thumb from the fist.üîΩThe gesture of the garland-bearer is to raise that [fist].üîΩThe gesture of the singer is to extend the fingers from that [fist].

original: de nyid las bskor nas bskyod pa ni gar mkhan ma'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las bskor nas bskyod pa ni gar mkhan ma'i'o //
translated: The gesture of the dancer is to rotate and shake that [fist].

original: bsdams pa de nyid mdun du gzhug la mdzub mo bsgreng ba ni bdug pa ma'i'o //
analyzed: bsdams pa de nyid mdun du gzhug la mdzub mo bsgreng ba ni bdug pa ma'i'o //
translated: For the incense-offering goddess, extend the index finger of that same mudra in front.

original: de nyid gyen du bskyed pa ni me tog ma'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid gyen du bskyed pa ni me tog ma'i'o //
translated: For the flower-offering goddess, raise it up.

original: mdun du mthe bong gnyis bsgreng nas bskor ba ni mar me ma'i'o //
analyzed: mdun du mthe bong gnyis bsgreng nas bskor ba ni mar me ma'i'o //
